article_title: Texas on track to surpass 2014 enrollment numbers
article_text:
Texas on track to surpass 2014 enrollment numbers

Photo: Gary Coronado /Houston Chronicle Majorie Monson hands out information about the Affordable Care Act...

Nearly a third of a million Texans have signed up for health care coverage through the Affordable Care Act’s federal exchange, putting the state on pace to overtake where it was at last year’s deadline to ensure coverage on Jan. 1, U.S. Health and Human Services officials said Wednesday.

article_metadata.description: Nearly a third of a million Texans have signed up for health care coverage through the Affordable Care Act’s federal exchange, putting the state on pace to overtake where it was at last year’s deadline to ensure coverage on Jan. 1, U.S. Health and Human Services officials said Wednesday.  Nationally, more than 2.8 million had signed up as of Dec. 5, with a million new enrollees just last week, said Andy Slavitt, acting administrator of the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid, during a phone-in news briefing.  About three-quarters of Texas enrollees will be able to find a plan for $75 per month or less with subsidies, according to HHS.
article_metadata.author.name: By Jenny Deam, Houston Chronicle

og.description: Nearly a third of a million Texans have signed up for health care coverage through the Affordable Care Act’s federal exchange, putting the state on pace to overtake where it was at last year’s deadline to ensure coverage on Jan. 1, U.S. Health and Human Services officials said Wednesday.  Nationally, more than 2.8 million had signed up as of Dec. 5, with a million new enrollees just last week, said Andy Slavitt, acting administrator of the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid, during a phone-in news briefing.  About three-quarters of Texas enrollees will be able to find a plan for $75 per month or less with subsidies, according to HHS.
